segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome back to EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 大家好，欢迎回到EnglishPod。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
segments.cn: 我叫Marco。

segments.en: And my name is Catherine.
segments.cn: 我叫Catherine。

segments.en: So, as usual, we've got a great dialogue for you today.
segments.cn: 所以，像往常一样，今天我们有一个很棒的对话。

segments.en: And before we get going, I should mention what the topic is.
segments.cn: 在开始之前，我应该提一下今天的话题。

segments.en: So, Marco, take it away.
segments.cn: Marco，你来吧。

segments.en: We are actually having a small fight at the office.
segments.cn: 我们实际上在办公室有点小争吵。

segments.en: Somebody or a co-worker is annoying us.
segments.cn: 有人或同事在烦我们。

segments.en: So, you know, sometimes co-workers, you see them every day, they're doing something that's maybe getting on your nerves.
segments.cn: 有时候，同事每天都见面，他们做的事情可能会让你感到烦躁。

segments.en: And you practically live together because you're with each other for eight, nine, ten hours every day.
segments.cn: 你几乎是和他们一起生活，因为每天要待八、九、十个小时。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So, that's what we're going to be looking at today, some language related to this topic.
segments.cn: 所以，今天我们要讨论的就是与这个话题相关的一些语言。

segments.en: So, let's listen to the dialogue for the first time.
segments.cn: 现在，让我们第一次听这个对话。

segments.en: Hey, Mary, can you cut that out?
segments.cn: 嘿，Mary，你能别这样吗？

segments.en: Cut what out?
segments.cn: 别什么？

segments.en: I'm not doing anything.
segments.cn: 我什么都没做。

segments.en: The tapping of your pen on your desk, it's driving me crazy.
segments.cn: 你在桌子上敲笔的声音让我快疯了。

segments.en: Fine.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: By the way, would you mind not slurping your coffee every time you have a cup?
segments.cn: 顺便问一下，你能不能每次喝咖啡的时候别发出啧啧声？

segments.en: I don't slurp my coffee.
segments.cn: 我没有啧啧声。

segments.en: And plus, how can you hear it when you're shouting into your phone all the time?
segments.cn: 而且，你怎么能听到呢，你一直在对着电话大喊？

segments.en: You've got to be kidding me.
segments.cn: 你在开玩笑吧。

segments.en: You're complaining about me talking on the phone when you go out for a cigarette break ten times a day to shoot the breeze?
segments.cn: 你在抱怨我打电话，而你一天要出去抽十次烟聊天？

segments.en: Look, we have a lot of accumulated anger from working in these conditions.
segments.cn: 听着，我们在这种环境下积累了很多愤怒。

segments.en: And it's probably okay to let off steam once in a while.
segments.cn: 偶尔发泄一下可能没问题。

segments.en: But it's probably not a good idea to keep it up.
segments.cn: 但持续下去可能不是个好主意。

segments.en: I'm willing to forgive and forget if you are.
segments.cn: 如果你愿意，我愿意原谅并忘记。

segments.en: Fine.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: Let's call a truce.
segments.cn: 我们达成休战吧。

segments.en: I'll try to be more considerate and keep the noise down.
segments.cn: 我会尽量更体贴，降低噪音。

segments.en: Yeah, I'll try to do the same.
segments.cn: 是的，我也会尽量做到。

segments.en: So, I was wondering, do you want to go out to dinner Friday night?
segments.cn: 所以，我在想，你想周五晚上出去吃晚餐吗？

segments.en: All right, we're back.
segments.cn: 好的，我们回来了。

segments.en: So, yeah, I think this is a common situation, right?
segments.cn: 所以，是的，我觉得这是一个常见的情况，对吧？

segments.en: So common, this might even be based on our own lives.
segments.cn: 这么常见，这甚至可能基于我们的生活。

segments.en: It is.
segments.cn: 确实如此。

segments.en: You may not know, but Catherine and I get into fights all the time.
segments.cn: 你可能不知道，但Catherine和我总是吵架。

segments.en: No, not really.
segments.cn: 不，实际上不是。

segments.en: All right, so I think there was some interesting words here, but mostly phrases.
segments.cn: 好吧，我觉得这里有一些有趣的词，但主要是短语。

segments.en: So, let's start with the words first.
segments.cn: 所以，我们先从单词开始。

segments.en: Language takeaway.
segments.cn: 语言要点。

segments.en: Language takeaway.
segments.cn: 语言要点。

segments.en: All right, so the first word, as you might have guessed, has to do with eating and drinking.
segments.cn: 好吧，第一个词，正如你可能猜到的，和吃喝有关。

segments.en: This is called slurping.
segments.cn: 这个叫做啧啧声。

segments.en: To slurp.
segments.cn: 啧啧。

segments.en: To slurp.
segments.cn: 啧啧。

segments.en: So, the noun, the thing is slurping.
segments.cn: 所以，名词是啧啧声。

segments.en: And it's very common with people who eat their food quickly.
segments.cn: 这在快速吃东西的人中很常见。

segments.en: Like soup.
segments.cn: 比如汤。

segments.en: Yeah, soup, or, you know... Noodles.
segments.cn: 是的，汤，或者，你知道的……面条。

segments.en: Yeah, or when they're eating soup noodles.
segments.cn: 是的，或者当他们吃汤面的时候。

segments.en: Or sometimes when you have a drink and you're drinking it through a straw, towards the end, you're just, like, trying to get the very last part at the bottom.
segments.cn: 或者有时当你喝饮料，通过吸管喝到最后时，你只是想把底部的最后一部分吸出来。

segments.en: So, yeah, the straw slurps.
segments.cn: 所以，是的，吸管会发出啧啧声。

segments.en: Yeah, so slurping, some people really can't stand it.
segments.cn: 是的，所以啧啧声，有些人真的受不了。

segments.en: Sometimes you don't even notice that you're doing it.
segments.cn: 有时你甚至没有注意到自己在做这件事。

segments.en: No, absolutely not.
segments.cn: 不，绝对不是。

segments.en: All right, so apart from slurping, what else do we have?
segments.cn: 好吧，除了啧啧声，我们还有什么？

segments.en: We've got a great word here.
segments.cn: 我们有一个很好的词。

segments.en: Accumulated.
segments.cn: 积累。

segments.en: So, a lot of accumulated anger.
segments.cn: 所以，很多积累的愤怒。

segments.en: The word is a verb.
segments.cn: 这个词是动词。

segments.en: To accumulate.
segments.cn: 积累。

segments.en: And what does that mean?
segments.cn: 那是什么意思？

segments.en: It means to kind of grow or to become more and more, all right?
segments.cn: 意思是有点增长或变得越来越多，好吗？

segments.en: So, you're, like, saving it.
segments.cn: 所以，你就像在保存它。

segments.en: Or even it's, like, building up.
segments.cn: 或者甚至是像在堆积。

segments.en: You know, we say this oftentimes in Chicago, where it snows a lot in the winter, that there's a foot of snow accumulated on the ground.
segments.cn: 你知道，我们常常在芝加哥说，冬天下很多雪，地上积累了一英尺的雪。

segments.en: That means there's a lot of snow.
segments.cn: 这意味着有很多雪。

segments.en: And every time it snows, it keeps getting bigger.
segments.cn: 每次下雪，它都会越来越多。

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: So, to accumulate.
segments.cn: 所以，积累。

segments.en: So, accumulated anger, your anger is getting bigger and bigger.
segments.cn: 所以，积累的愤怒，你的愤怒越来越大。

segments.en: Right, because you never tell anyone about your anger.
segments.cn: 对，因为你从来没有告诉任何人你的愤怒。

segments.en: So, it keeps building and it keeps piling up.
segments.cn: 所以，它不断积累。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: Well, towards the end, they said, well, let's call a truce.
segments.cn: 在最后，他们说，嗯，让我们达成休战。

segments.en: So, they want to call a truce.
segments.cn: 所以，他们想达成休战。

segments.en: All right, a truce is another word for a peace.
segments.cn: 好吧，休战是和平的另一种说法。

segments.en: And so, this is a way that you can stop fighting and say that you and I have been fighting for a long time.
segments.cn: 所以，这是一种停止争吵的方式，表示你和我已经争吵很久了。

segments.en: And we may not come to a deal, but we'll say, truce, from now on, we just won't fight.
segments.cn: 我们可能不会达成协议，但我们会说，休战，从现在开始，我们就不再争吵。

segments.en: Won't fight about it.
segments.cn: 不会再争吵。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: Brothers and sisters often call truces.
segments.cn: 兄弟姐妹们经常会达成休战。

segments.en: Truce.
segments.cn: 休战。

segments.en: And, well, if you're calling a truce, you're trying to be more considerate.
segments.cn: 而且，如果你在达成休战，你就是在努力变得更体贴。

segments.en: Okay, considerate, like you're saying, is a way to be or a way to act.
segments.cn: 好吧，体贴，就像你说的，是一种行为方式。

segments.en: And considerate often has to do with how you act towards other people.
segments.cn: 而体贴通常与你对待他人的方式有关。

segments.en: So, it's being nice to other people or thinking about other people's feelings before yourself.
segments.cn: 所以，善待他人或在自己之前考虑他人的感受。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: So, if you're considerate, then you are maybe more polite.
segments.cn: 所以，如果你体贴，那么你可能更有礼貌。

segments.en: You think about the other person's feelings before you do anything.
segments.cn: 你在做任何事情之前考虑对方的感受。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: You just say nice little things like, please, and thank you, and I'm sorry.
segments.cn: 你只需说一些礼貌的话，比如，请、谢谢和对不起。

segments.en: And these things are all ways of being considerate.
segments.cn: 这些都是体贴的表现。

segments.en: Very good.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: So, four great words on language takeaway.
segments.cn: 所以，四个很好的语言要点。

segments.en: Why don't we move on now to fluency builder?
segments.cn: 我们现在为什么不继续进行流利度训练呢？

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: So, as we mentioned, this dialogue is very, very rich in a lot of different phrases.
segments.cn: 正如我们提到的，这个对话在很多不同的短语中非常丰富。

segments.en: So, let's start with a couple of them.
segments.cn: 那么，我们先从几个短语开始。

segments.en: The very first one and the title of the lesson.
segments.cn: 第一个也是课程的标题。

segments.en: Cut it out.
segments.cn: 别这样。

segments.en: Cut that out.
segments.cn: 别那样。

segments.en: Hey, Mary, can you cut that out?
segments.cn: 嘿，玛丽，你能别那样吗？

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So, you're not actually saying to cut something with scissors or something.
segments.cn: 所以，你并不是在说用剪刀剪什么。

segments.en: No, this is... it's a way of saying, can you stop that?
segments.cn: 不，这是一种说法，意思是你能停下来吗？

segments.en: Stop it.
segments.cn: 停止。

segments.en: Stop doing that.
segments.cn: 别再这样做。

segments.en: Stop it.
segments.cn: 停止。

segments.en: Quit it.
segments.cn: 住手。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: Cut that out.
segments.cn: 别那样。

segments.en: Cut it out.
segments.cn: 别这样。

segments.en: So, if someone's doing something that's really annoying to you, it's not very nice to say, but you can say, hey, cut that out.
segments.cn: 所以，如果有人做的事情让你很烦，虽然说得不太好，但你可以说，嘿，别那样。

segments.en: Cut it out.
segments.cn: 别这样。

segments.en: Or if someone's doing something mean to someone, like my brother used to hit me, my mom would say, Peter, cut that out.
segments.cn: 或者如果有人对别人很刻薄，比如我哥哥以前打我，我妈妈会说，彼得，别这样。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: So, it is a good mom phrase as well.
segments.cn: 所以，这也是一个好妈妈的短语。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: Moving on to our next phrase.
segments.cn: 继续我们的下一个短语。

segments.en: The guy said that the tapping on the desk was driving him crazy.
segments.cn: 那个家伙说敲桌子的声音让他快疯了。

segments.en: It's driving me crazy.
segments.cn: 这让我快疯了。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: To drive someone crazy means to make someone just feel like they're going nuts.
segments.cn: 让某人疯狂的意思是让某人感觉快要发疯。

segments.en: Or, you know, just it makes you kind of angry or frustrated or tense.
segments.cn: 或者，让你感到愤怒、沮丧或紧张。

segments.en: But it can also be used like in a romantic sense, right?
segments.cn: 但它也可以在浪漫的意义上使用，对吧？

segments.en: That girl drives me crazy.
segments.cn: 那个女孩让我疯狂。

segments.en: It means like he can't even think about anything else.
segments.cn: 这意味着他根本无法想其他事情。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: So, in this case, what drives you crazy?
segments.cn: 那么，在这种情况下，是什么让你疯狂？

segments.en: When... I'll tell you what drives me crazy.
segments.cn: 当... 我告诉你是什么让我疯狂。

segments.en: When people clip their fingernails and toenails at the office.
segments.cn: 当人们在办公室剪指甲和脚趾甲。

segments.en: Can't believe it.
segments.cn: 真不敢相信。

segments.en: Well, it drives me crazy.
segments.cn: 嗯，这让我疯狂。

segments.en: Like, for example, when somebody or my brother leaves his clothes lying on the floor in the living room.
segments.cn: 比如，当有人或我哥哥把衣服扔在客厅的地板上。

segments.en: That's annoying too.
segments.cn: 这也很烦。

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: So, that drives me crazy.
segments.cn: 所以，这让我疯狂。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: So, moving on to our third phrase.
segments.cn: 继续我们的第三个短语。

segments.en: This is a pretty big one, but take it as a whole.
segments.cn: 这是一个相当重要的短语，但要整体理解。

segments.en: You've got to be kidding me.
segments.cn: 你在开玩笑吧。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: So, this is, as you said, a fixed phrase.
segments.cn: 所以，这正如你所说，是一个固定短语。

segments.en: These words usually go together and it is a perfect example of sarcasm.
segments.cn: 这些词通常是一起使用的，是讽刺的完美例子。

segments.en: So, it's a way... The way you say it is very important.
segments.cn: 所以，表达的方式非常重要。

segments.en: So, I could say, you've got to be kidding me.
segments.cn: 我可以说，你在开玩笑吧。

segments.en: What's a good situation for this?
segments.cn: 这种情况有什么好例子？

segments.en: Maybe I get to the airport and I'm running late and I'm really happy that I get there on time.
segments.cn: 也许我到达机场时已经迟到了，我很高兴按时到达。

segments.en: And then I see the flight is delayed seven hours.
segments.cn: 然后我看到航班延误了七个小时。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: You've got to be kidding me.
segments.cn: 你在开玩笑吧。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So, it's a way of saying I can't believe it.
segments.cn: 所以，这是一种说我不敢相信的方式。

segments.en: Or seriously, this isn't...
segments.cn: 或者说，真的，这不是...

segments.en: What's happening?
segments.cn: 发生了什么？

segments.en: Or what bad luck?
segments.cn: 或者真倒霉？

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So, it is a sarcastic phrase, but use it as a whole.
segments.cn: 所以，这是一个讽刺的短语，但要整体使用。

segments.en: Usually, you don't change the subject.
segments.cn: 通常，你不会改变主语。

segments.en: You don't say, you've got to be kidding him.
segments.cn: 你不会说，你在开玩笑他。

segments.en: No, it's always this.
segments.cn: 不，总是这样。

segments.en: You've got to be kidding me.
segments.cn: 你在开玩笑吧。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: Or, you've got to be kidding me.
segments.cn: 或者，你在开玩笑吧。

segments.en: See?
segments.cn: 明白了吗？

segments.en: Different meanings with different inflections.
segments.cn: 不同的语调有不同的意思。

segments.en: Different inflections.
segments.cn: 不同的语调。

segments.en: Very good.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: What's our next phrase?
segments.cn: 我们下一个短语是什么？

segments.en: Our next phrase is a good one because it doesn't mean what it sounds like, okay?
segments.cn: 我们下一个短语很好，因为它的意思与听起来的不一样，好吗？

segments.en: So, to shoot the breeze, all right?
segments.cn: 所以，闲聊，好吗？

segments.en: Shoot means like you can shoot a gun and breeze is like the wind.
segments.cn: 射击意味着你可以开枪，微风就像风。

segments.en: But here, to shoot the breeze is to have a nice little conversation, just to talk about nothing.
segments.cn: 但在这里，闲聊是指进行一次愉快的小谈话，只是聊聊无关紧要的事情。

segments.en: Okay, so not really do anything, just talk a little bit.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以并不是真的做什么，只是聊聊。

segments.en: Right, so if we think about this in the context of this sentence, it's, you know, you go out for your cigarette break 10 times a day to shoot the breeze.
segments.cn: 对，所以如果我们在这个句子的上下文中考虑，就是，你知道，你每天抽十次烟去闲聊。

segments.en: So, this means you go outside, you just talk about nothing and whatever, and it's almost like you're wasting time just talking.
segments.cn: 所以，这意味着你出去，只是聊聊无关紧要的事情，几乎就像是在浪费时间。

segments.en: Okay, so shooting the breeze.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以闲聊。

segments.en: You can say, oh, we were just shooting the breeze.
segments.cn: 你可以说，哦，我们只是闲聊。

segments.en: Just have a nice little conversation, nothing important.
segments.cn: 只是进行一次愉快的小谈话，没什么重要的。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: And our last phrase for today, forgive and forget.
segments.cn: 我们今天的最后一个短语，原谅和忘记。

segments.en: Let's forgive and forget.
segments.cn: 让我们原谅和忘记。

segments.en: Let's forgive and forget.
segments.cn: 让我们原谅和忘记。

segments.en: These words, again, like the last phrases, go together.
segments.cn: 这些词，和之前的短语一样，是一起使用的。

segments.en: Forgive and forget.
segments.cn: 原谅和忘记。

segments.en: So, I could say this to you, Marco.
segments.cn: 所以，我可以对你说，马尔科。

segments.en: I say, I know you've been fighting with your brother for 10 years.
segments.cn: 我说，我知道你和你哥哥争吵了十年。

segments.en: I say, finally, just forgive and forget.
segments.cn: 我说，最后，原谅和忘记吧。

segments.en: That means just put everything behind you and try and start again.
segments.cn: 这意味着把一切抛在脑后，尝试重新开始。

segments.en: Okay, let it go.
segments.cn: 好吧，放下。

segments.en: Yeah, forgive the person, forget about it, move on.
segments.cn: 是的，原谅那个人，忘掉它，继续前进。

segments.en: Okay, forgive and forget.
segments.cn: 好吧，原谅和忘记。

segments.en: Very good.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: So, very interesting phrases.
segments.cn: 所以，非常有趣的短语。

segments.en: I think they're very useful and this is very colloquial English, right?
segments.cn: 我认为它们非常有用，这些都是非常口语化的英语，对吧？

segments.en: Absolutely.
segments.cn: 绝对是。

segments.en: This is stuff that you're going to hear all the time, but maybe not all together at the same time.
segments.cn: 这些是你会经常听到的东西，但可能不会同时听到。

segments.en: Definitely, though, very helpful for interacting with foreign friends and colleagues.
segments.cn: 当然，这对与外国朋友和同事互动非常有帮助。

segments.en: Very good.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: So, let's listen to the dialogue for the last time and we'll be right back.
segments.cn: 那么，让我们最后一次听对话，我们马上回来。

segments.en: Hey, Mary, can you cut that out?
segments.cn: 嘿，玛丽，你能不这样吗？

segments.en: Cut what out?
segments.cn: 不这样做什么？

segments.en: I'm not doing anything.
segments.cn: 我什么都没做。

segments.en: The tapping of your pen on your desk, it's driving me crazy.
segments.cn: 你在桌子上敲笔的声音让我快疯了。

segments.en: Fine.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: By the way, would you mind not slurping your coffee every time you have a cup?
segments.cn: 顺便问一下，你能不能每次喝咖啡时不要发出吸吮声？

segments.en: I don't slurp my coffee.
segments.cn: 我不吸吮我的咖啡。

segments.en: And plus, how can you hear it when you're shouting into your phone all the time?
segments.cn: 而且，你怎么能听到呢，你一直在对着电话大喊？

segments.en: You've got to be kidding me.
segments.cn: 你在开玩笑吧。

segments.en: You're complaining about me talking on the phone when you go out for a cigarette break 10 times a day to shoot the breeze?
segments.cn: 你在抱怨我打电话，而你一天要出去抽十次烟聊天？

segments.en: Look, we have a lot of accumulated anger from working in these conditions.
segments.cn: 听着，我们在这种环境下工作积累了很多愤怒。

segments.en: And it's probably okay to let off steam once in a while.
segments.cn: 偶尔发泄一下可能没问题。

segments.en: But it's probably not a good idea to keep it up.
segments.cn: 但持续这样可能不是个好主意。

segments.en: I'm willing to forgive and forget if you are.
segments.cn: 如果你愿意，我愿意原谅并忘记。

segments.en: Fine.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: Let's call a truce.
segments.cn: 我们达成休战。

segments.en: I'll try to be more considerate and keep the noise down.
segments.cn: 我会尽量更体贴，保持安静。

segments.en: Yeah, I'll try to do the same.
segments.cn: 是的，我也会尽量这样做。

segments.en: So, I was wondering.
segments.cn: 所以，我在想。

segments.en: You want to go out to dinner Friday night?
segments.cn: 你想周五晚上出去吃晚餐吗？

segments.en: So, did you ever see the TV show Full House when you were a kid?
segments.cn: 那么，你小时候看过《满屋》这个电视节目吗？

segments.en: I did.
segments.cn: 看过。

segments.en: I did.
segments.cn: 看过。

segments.en: It was a popular...
segments.cn: 这是个受欢迎的...

segments.en: With the Olsen twins and all those, right?
segments.cn: 有奥尔森双胞胎和那些人，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah, and Bob Saget.
segments.cn: 是的，还有鲍勃·萨盖特。

segments.en: So, there was an uncle on the show, Uncle Joey.
segments.cn: 所以，节目里有个叔叔，乔伊叔叔。

segments.en: And he always used to say, cut it out.
segments.cn: 他总是说，别这样。

segments.en: And he had like hand motions for it.
segments.cn: 他还有手势。

segments.en: And so, cut it out is a way to say kind of stop it, quit it.
segments.cn: 所以，别这样就是一种停止、停止的说法。

segments.en: You're killing me.
segments.cn: 你让我受不了。

segments.en: It's like he was saying, too funny.
segments.cn: 就像他说，太搞笑了。

segments.en: And so, whenever I hear this phrase, I always think of that early 90s TV show.
segments.cn: 所以，每当我听到这个短语时，我总是想起那个90年代初的电视节目。

segments.en: Very early 90s.
segments.cn: 非常早的90年代。

segments.en: Well, this whole situation with The Office as well.
segments.cn: 嗯，这整个《办公室》的情况也是。

segments.en: I think there was a TV show called The Office, right?
segments.cn: 我想有个叫《办公室》的电视节目，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah, there was the British Office and then there was an American version.
segments.cn: 是的，有英国版《办公室》，还有美国版。

segments.en: And it's also something about office life and how colleagues get on each other's nerves and they play pranks on each other and everyone's kind of weird.
segments.cn: 这也是关于办公室生活的，讲同事之间如何互相烦扰，互相恶作剧，每个人都有点奇怪。

segments.en: And everyone drives everyone else crazy.
segments.cn: 每个人都让其他人疯狂。

segments.en: No, it's funny because once you start working in an office full-time, I mean, everyone's maybe had a little bit of office experience, but when it's full-time, you spend more time with your colleagues than you do with your family.
segments.cn: 不，这很有趣，因为一旦你开始全职在办公室工作，我的意思是，每个人可能都有一点办公室经验，但当是全职时，你和同事在一起的时间比和家人还多。

segments.en: It's really amazing what makes you crazy, what drives you crazy, and what stuff just doesn't matter.
segments.cn: 真的很神奇，是什么让你疯狂，是什么让你发疯，什么事情根本不重要。

segments.en: So, this is an interesting topic.
segments.cn: 所以，这是个有趣的话题。

segments.en: We really want to hear from you guys.
segments.cn: 我们真的想听听你们的意见。

segments.en: Many of you probably work at an office, so tell us.
segments.cn: 你们中的许多人可能在办公室工作，所以告诉我们。

segments.en: So, come and tell us what drives you crazy.
segments.cn: 所以，来告诉我们是什么让你疯狂。

segments.en: Maybe what colleague is driving you mad.
segments.cn: 也许是什么同事让你发疯。

segments.en: You don't have to use names.
segments.cn: 你不必使用名字。

segments.en: You can just use nicknames if you want.
segments.cn: 如果你愿意，可以用昵称。

segments.en: Right, so we'll be waiting for you at EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 对，所以我们在EnglishPod.com等你。

segments.en: Leave questions and comments and we'll see you guys next time.
segments.cn: 留下问题和评论，我们下次见。

segments.en: Yep, bye everyone.
segments.cn: 是的，大家再见。
